results.title: River of no return
results.creator_credit: Stanley Rubin, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Otto Preminger
results.brief_description: Matt Calder (Robert Mitchum), is a widower with a dubious past, attempting to restart his life with his young son Mark. Harry Weston (Rory Calhoun) is a lawless gambler with his fiancee Kay (Marilyn Monroe). Calder rescues Weston and Kay from the river only to have Weston rob him and abandon them to the mercy of warring Indians. Calder takes Kay and Mark on a dangerous journey of revenge down the raging river. The chemistry between Mitchum and Monroe and the awe-inspiring backdrop of Canada’s breathtaking secenery are the highlights of this tense western thriller.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stanley Rubin, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Otto Preminger

results.title: River of life
results.creator_credit: Ralph Keene, Independent Artists (GB) and John Taylor
results.brief_description: Changing moods of the Welsh River Usk followed through the seasons of the year. Delicate camera-work reveals activities, rare to the naked eye, of species living in and around the river - the microscopic diatoms and leeches, insects, birds and fish - all contributing to the intricate society of the river’s life.

results.title: River of hope
results.creator_credit: M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: The Damodar Valley Project. The Damodar River in Dihar is known as the River of Sorrow; during the monsoon its floods cause death and destruction on a gigantic scale. The Damodar Valley Project is combating this with a series of dams on the river and its tributaries, and a barrage across the confluence of the Damodar and the Barakar Rivers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India

results.title: River of diamonds
results.creator_credit: J. Blake Dalrymple, Films of Africa and Antony Thomas
results.brief_description: Gives the colorful history of the Orange River, lifeblood of half of South Africa’s cities in the east and its farms in the west. We see the mountains where the river rises, the farms and cities along its course, with the dams and tunnels now changing its face. Diamond mining has been the major industry since diamonds were discovered in 1866; now underwater drilling has commenced where the Orange enters the sea.

results.title: River Murray
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Eltham Films and Alan Harkness
results.brief_description: Early settlers were plagued by flood and drought along the Murray, today the waters are controlled by the various dams, locks and canals which have been constructed along its course. Includes the Hume Reservoir, Mulwala Canal and the channel at Frenchman’s Creek. Now floodwaters are checked, dry lands irrigated, electric power is generated, useless land can be reclaimed, and the river is navigable from the mouth to a point just beyond Mildura. The film also considers the effect of this system on the development of New South Wales, Victoria and South Australia.

results.title: River journey on the Upper Nile
results.creator_credit: Institut für Film und Bild and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: Examines the Upper Nile from Malakal to Juba in the Sudan. Describes the Shilluk and Dinka peoples of the region and how they are unable to produce enough food to subsist and are forced to acquire additional supplies from Juba. The film follows the journey made down the Nile River to Juba during the rainy season and shows the conditions of the regions which the river flows through.

results.title: River (Planet earth)
results.creator_credit: Peter Raymont, ONF | NFB and Planet Earth
results.brief_description: Takes a look at the Saskatchewan-Nelson river system in order to examine the impact which a water system has upon the economy, sociology and ecology of a nation.

results.title: River's edge
results.creator_credit: Hemdale Film Corporation, Sarah Pillsbury, Midge Sanford and Tim Hunter
results.brief_description: This film is a story of today’s teenagers poised perilously on the brink between adolescence and adulthood. When one of them murders his girl-friend, the others must decide for themselves which is more important - admitting knowledge of a dreadful deed, or staying loyal to a close friend. They do not know how to react and their plight is one with which everyone - young and old - can identify. It is an extraordinary document of teen life today, showing how adolescents can seem almost numbed by even the most intense, extreme situations. This film is disturbing, thought-provoking and based on a real-life incident. WARNING: SOME SCENES IN THIS FILM MAY BE DISTURBING TO SOME VIEWERS.

results.title: Rive Droite, Rive Gauche = Right Bank, Left Bank
results.brief_description:
For the love of Sacha, a Left Bank public relations manager, Paul Senanques, a Right Bank business counsel provokes a political scandal by exposing his biggest client, Pervillard, as an unscrupulous business man. Now Paul and Sacha must contend with the wrath of Pervillard and Paul’s wife.

Credits: Producer, Alain Terzian ; director, Philippe Labro ; writers, Philippe Labro, Francoise Labro ; photography, Pascal Marti ; music, Michel Berger.
Cast: Gerard Depardieu, Nathalie Baye, Carole Bouquet, Bernard Fresson, Charlotte de Turckheim, Jacques Weber.

results.title: Rivals. Abseiling. Wave jumping
results.creator_credit: Kay Francis, Tony Wheeler, Jason Morris, Tom McPartland, Health Media and Education Centre and New South Wales. Dept. of Health
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Buzz”.
1. Rivals (5 min.) examines the competition, drive and energy involved in athletic sports for the disabled highlighting wheelchair racing. 2. Abseiling (5 min.) shows a group of adolescents from Fairfield Police Boys Club, Sydney being taught rock climbing. 3. Wave Jumping (5 min) examines the popular surf sports of windsurfing and sailboarding from both technical and recreational perspectives.
